Nightlight :

Nightlight suspected what was happening so she knew that she =
msut be patient and wait



  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Richard=
 Allen 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, November 16, 2007 10:=
13 PM
  Subject: Re: Gladiators Collide


  ::Rodimus Prime::

  Rodimus ge=
stures to Remus, signaling him to fall back.

  Rodimus: The same deal with=
 you Scourge. You are out of place. Fall back.

  Rodimus then gets the com=
m message from Nightlight. He opens the comm.

  Rodimus: Rodimus here, Nig=
htlight. Stand by.

  Rodimus quickly turns off the comm. He was careful to=
 not acknowledge Nightlight as anything more then a fellow Maximal in earsh=
ot of the enemy. The Minions did not need to know he had a wife.

  Super C=
yclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

    The skies seem to darken as t=
he sweeps rise into the air as a single flowing mass, even as the last weap=
ons fire rips into the skies, then there's silence! The plague that is the =
unicronian sweeps appears, at least for the moment, to be halted!

    At t=
he water's edge Cyclonus looks down at Rodimus even as he is forced to spin=
 and dodge the incoming laser fire. He managed to catch Kup's laser blasts =
with his hands, again absorbing the energies into his systems, only to be h=
ave rockets streak at him from Rodimus Prime's attack! A last minute detona=
tion of them with his pulse cannon explodes them in the air in front of him=
, yet the force of it still blows him backward and slamming him into the wa=
ll. Anger curls itself around Cyclonus' face, and he is a fraction of a sec=
ond from returning the attack when he hears Rodimus' stand down order and t=
he city goes quiet. 

    Scourge arrives in the skies behind Cyclonus and =
transforms. Noting his commander condition he powers up his cannons ready t=
o rip into anything that moves against them. Cyclonus' silence is thoughtfu=
l and grim as he looked down at Rodimus, for the moment ignoring Remus. His=
 only movement is only a slight gesture to Scourge as he comes in behind hi=
m to forestall any attacks on the Maximals or Autobots present. 

    Final=
ly Cyclonus nodded to Rodimus as he and Scourge fly out over the sea and to=
wards their place of meeting, Cyclonus' face is thoughtful, the powerful gl=
ow of his optics dimming somewhat as the damage to Cyclonus armor glows and=
 knits. 

    Scourge though does not take all of this with the equamity of=
 Cyclonus, he eyes Remus, "Rodimus Prime!" the sweep commander's voice is a=
s it was in former days, but like Cyclonus there is something more in it. "=
Your soldier is out of place. Remove him, or we will!"

    Behind the duo =
the sweeps swing in, a swarm of hunter-terminators, ready to perform their =
function to the utmost, and yet for the moment quiescent.

    Preston
    =
(Da'minion)
